isis.stitle: HENDRICKSON SUSPENSION SYSTEMS - DESCRIPTION - U/UE, RT/RTE, RT2/RTE2 SERIES

svcproc.title: U/UE, RT/RTE, RT2/RTE2 SERIES

note.para: Effective July 17, 1995, the RT2/RTE2 Series replaced the RT/RTE Series. The leaf springs, spring saddles and spring hangers are not interchangeable. The International codes did not change for the new series. When performing service, it will be necessary to have the International code and VIN code when ordering parts. Service procedures will be the same except where noted in this publication.

svcproc.para: The leaf spring type Hendrickson suspension systems use semi-elliptical leaf springs to cushion the load against road shocks. The springs are mounted on saddle assemblies above the equalizer beams, and pivot at the front end on spring pins and brackets. The rear ends of the springs move back and forth as the springs deflect.

Some leaf spring Hendrickson suspension systems have an additional axle stop (spring bracket) at the rear of the frame ( Figure 4). These systems have the top four leaves extended through the rear spring rear bracket to the axle stop. This design provides a two-stage spring rate which allows the suspension to give a good empty ride, and yet maintain good springing and stability for loaded conditions.

figure.caption: Figure 4. Hendrickson U, RT, RTS, UE, RTE, RTE2 Series

svcproc.para: To maintain this ride feature, there must be available a minimum clearance of 3/8 inch (9.5 mm) between the cam surfaces of the rear spring rear brackets and the top surfaces of the main leaves in unloaded condition ( Figure 5).
